person.persName: Alpheus B. Miller (Louisville Brick Layer/2nd/34th KY Infantry)

body.p: Native of Kentucky. Worked as a brick layer in Louisville. Served as a private in company H of the 2nd Kentucky Infantry and company D of the 34th Kentucky Infantry during the Civil War. In 1861, he was charged with intimidating a witness regarding his son, Charles, theft of bed clothes. In 1864, his son Charles again found himself accused of theft, and Alpheus worked for his pardon.

Spouse: Amanda Miller
Children: Charles Miller, George Miller, Florence Miller, Mary Miller
